Interface ec.encoding.StandardDecodable

public interface interface StandardDecodable
extends Decodable
A StandardDecodable is the interface to implement for objects that wish to have an instance method called on them to complete decoding. That method, decodeBody(), is called with the body arguments originally returned from an encode(). It is guaranteed that the runtime will not call any other methods on a StandardDecodable between the time that decode() is called and the time that decodeBody() is called.

decodeBody(Object[])
Decode the body of this object.

decodeBody 
 public abstract void decodeBody(Object bodyArgs[])
Decode the body of this object. This is called on instances returned by the static decode() method in order to fully instantiate them, assuming that the decode() method returned an instance of ContinueDecoding. The runtime guarantees that it will not call any methods on an instance between the time of its return from decode() and the time that decodeInstance() is called.

Parameters:
bodyArgs - the body arguments of the desired instance
